intro: Carmichaelia arenaria, commonly known as the sandpiper plant, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its low-growing habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Carmichaelia arenaria is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
